intro: Gilibertia trifida, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow, bell-shaped flowers. The plant has palmate leaves with three to five lobes, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Gilibertia trifida is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions. It is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
